entries.name: new(typename, obj) → WIN32OLE_RECORD objectclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns WIN32OLE_RECORD object. The first argument is struct name (String or Symbol). The second parameter obj should be WIN32OLE object or WIN32OLE_TYPELIB object. If COM server in VB.NET ComServer project is the following:

entries.name: WIN32OLE_RECORD#inspect → Stringclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the OLE struct name and member name and the value of member

entries.name: WIN32OLE_RECORD#method_missing(name)click to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns value specified by the member name of VT_RECORD OLE variable. Or sets value specified by the member name of VT_RECORD OLE variable. If the member name is not correct, KeyError exception is raised.

entries.name: WIN32OLE_RECORD#ole_instance_variable_get(name)click to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns value specified by the member name of VT_RECORD OLE object. If the member name is not correct, KeyError exception is raised. If you can't access member variable of VT_RECORD OLE object directly, use this method.

entries.name: WIN32OLE_RECORD#ole_instance_variable_set(name, val)click to toggle source
entries.desc: Sets value specified by the member name of VT_RECORD OLE object. If the member name is not correct, KeyError exception is raised. If you can't set value of member of VT_RECORD OLE object directly, use this method.

entries.name: WIN32OLE_RECORD#to_h #=> Ruby Hash object.click to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns Ruby Hash object which represents VT_RECORD variable. The keys of Hash object are member names of VT_RECORD OLE variable and the values of Hash object are values of VT_RECORD OLE variable.

entries.name: WIN32OLE_RECORD#typename #=> String objectclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the type name of VT_RECORD OLE variable.
